step.cmd: Expand the Design Studio folder and select Import T24 Resources then click Next.
step.stepresult: The T24 Resources Import wizard will then be displayed.

step.cmd: The Server Selection dialog shows next. Select the server where your T24 data is and click Next button.
step.stepresult: The subsequent dialog will ask you where you want to import the resource(s) to.

step.cmd: In the project-models section choose a folder under the rim where you wish the resource to import to and name the new reource file, only then you can click Next button.
Select the Applications you want to include in the imported resource and click Next .
step.info: The T24 Application Name Selection dialog allows the user to filter enquiries by Application, Product and Component. A wildcard (*) can be used in the Application section - the others are drop down selectors. As filters are used the matching values will appear in the preview window, these can then be selected individually or with the Select All button.

step.cmd: Select the enquiries you want to include in the imported resource and click Next .
step.info: The T24 Enquiry Name Selection dialog allows the user to filter enquiries by Application, Enquiry Name, Module and Component. A wildcard (*) can be used in the Enquiry Name section - the others are drop down selectors. As filters are used the matching values will appear in the preview window, these can then be selected individually or with the Select All button.

step.cmd: Select the screens you want to include in the imported resource and click Next .
step.info: The T24 Screen Name Selection dialog allows the user to filter enquiries by Application, Screen Name, Module and Component. A wildcard (*) can be used in the Screen Name section - the others are drop down selectors. As filters are used the matching values will appear in the preview window, these can then be selected individually or with the Select All button.

step.stepresult: An information panel will appear summarizing the imported data count and location, and errors if any occurred.

taskbody.result: The rim is imported in your workspace.

postreq.note: The T24 Resource or RIM is used to provide a standard link methodology to a resource, whether it is in T24 or in another external system. The resource details for T24 data vary between a read only type such as an Enquiry to a resource which can be updated or deleted. In the latter the rules and resource links to provide that functionality are included in the resource record.
